review: We've used a few devices for streaming services and our media library and this is the best device we've used yet.We have a WD TV live (older model) and that was small and convenient but didn't have the processing power so it lagged, the menus weren't as robust and Hulu Plus froze frequently. Not to mention the Hulu Plus interface was sparse and didn't give the same options to access our favorites for some reason.We mainly used, and loved, our PS3 but it died, and not from overuse as a gaming system-besides Guitar Hero it was basically a glorified Blu Ray player. It wasn't an easily transportable system but the processing power was there so there was minor lag, if any. Displays were robust. It used a lot of power and got loud and hot when on too long- which was more often than I care to admit with small children at home. We purchased a used one cheap, it lasted about a year and when it went we turned to other options.We have a Samsung Blu Ray player with Smart Hub- again, nothing recent. Not portable, no processing power, displays were terrible, lag was horrible and it froze on us a few times. Went back to the WD TV Live- started to consider purchasing another used PS3. Then I was on Amazon and saw the Fire TV, read the reviews and we decided to give it a try. We are so glad we did.My husband and I are picky on different levels. We are both loving this device. Fast, small and portable (we once took our WD on a vacation at a rented house). The menus on the streaming services are beautiful, all options there. The picture we swear is clearer, there's NO lag, nothing freezes, we are trying out Prime and love their selection of kids shows and best of all- with a busy house life- the screen saver is a SCREEN SAVER!! We often have to pause or we just don't select a show right away and we've had menus burn in the screen temporarily. We are still exploring the options for the media server. There is an app called Plex that's $5. We haven't purchased it yet. Might just use the Blu Ray player for now. We will be recommending this device to everyone! Already started.

review: I have a wonderful Sony Wega digital ready TV that does not have HDMI ports. I was determined to connect the fire TV to this set even though I was told it was impossible.  I first tried an HDMI to component converter and could see a poor quality picture but no sound despite a lot of fiddling. Next I tried an HDMI to composite converter, and it worked for a few hours and then stopped working. Mysterious, but the converter must have failed.  I set out to the local RadioShack and found a good helper that didn't say it was impossible.  I ended up with a bag of possibilities, and 10 minutes later, it was working beautifully!  I simply use a HDMI to DVI cable to connect the video, and an optical audio to component audio converter for sound. The picture and sound work beautifully now.I really like the free time for my kids- great selection of videos, and my 4 year old is obsessed with some of the games. Overall, I am happy.  I just wish Amazon would post more options for connecting Fire TV to a TV without HDMI
